newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil to assess risk of importing African cocoa.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to assess risk of importing African cocoa.

text.p: Technicians from Brazil's Agriculture Ministry are expected next month to travel to the Ivory Coast and another African country to conduct a risk analysis survey of cocoa imports into Brazil, an official said.
The survey has been requested by importers who have already this year had to bring in cocoa from Indonesia to supplement domestic output.

Indonesia is currently the only country which has been pre-certified as free of risk by the Brazilian government following new regulations set down after a number of problems with the purchase of 5,000 tonnes of Ivorian beans in 1995.

The Agriculture Ministry official said the other African country was likely to be Ghana and and that the results of the survey could be ready by the end of August depending on whether importers wanted to bring in cocoa from a specific region or wanted a more general analysis.
"If they want to bring in cocoa from any area of the Ivory Coast, for example, it could take longer," the official said.
